metadata.title: CVE-2021-38497 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Through use of reportValidity() and window.open(), a plain-text validationmessage could have been overlaid on another origin, leading to possibleuser confusion and spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox <93, Thunderbird < 91.2, and Firefox ESR < 91.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38497` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '93.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
